body.p: Within a project, individual transcripts (or sessions) are organized into a series of one or more corpora.

Each corpus typically contains a series of sessions relating to one specific participant in a study. The corpus may contain as many sessions as desired for that participant, spanning any length of time. This allows the user to easily search all transcripts relating to one participant, by searching within the relevant corpus.
When a corpus is selected, the number of sessions and a description of that corpus is displayed at the bottom of the list of corpora.

topic.title: Create Corpus
topic.shortdesc: Create a new corpus in an existing project.

body.section: First, a project must be open.

li.p: Choose the Project New Corpus... menu item.
li.itemgroup: The New Corpus dialog will appear.

li.p: Enter a name (and optionally a description) for the new corpus. Click Ok.
li.itemgroup: This creates a new corpus with the specified name inside the open project. An error message will appear if a corpus with that name already exists.You may return to edit the description at any time by clicking on the corpus name in the Project Manager and typing a description in the field below the Corpus list.

topic.title: Rename Corpus
topic.shortdesc: Rename a corpus in your project.

li.p: Right-click (CTRL+click) on the corpus you wish to rename and choose Rename Corpus from the context menu.
li.itemgroup: The Rename Corpus window will appear.

li.p: Follow the instructions in the Rename Corpus window. If you are unsure whether you want to rename your corpus, click Cancel. To continue and rename the corpus, click OK.
li.itemgroup: You will return to the Project Manager window and the corpus will be renamed accordingly.

topic.title: Delete Corpus
topic.shortdesc: Delete a corpus in your project.

li.p: Right-click (CTRL+click) on the corpus you wish to delete and choose Delete Corpus from the context menu.
li.itemgroup: A dialog will appear asking you to confirm whether you would like to delete this corpus and informing you that this action cannot be undone.

li.p: If you are unsure, click No. To continue and delete the corpus, click Yes.
li.itemgroup: The deleted corpus will no longer appear in the Project Manager window.

topic.title: Duplicate Corpus
topic.shortdesc: Dupliate a corpus folder in your project.

li.p: Right-click (CTRL+click) on the corpus you wish to duplicate and choose Duplicate Corpus from the context menu.
li.itemgroup: The corpus folder will be duplicated with an integer suffix (e.g., '(1)') appended.

topic.title: Edit Corpus Template
topic.shortdesc: Set default participants and tiers for all sessions to be created in a corpus.

li.p: Right-click (CTRL+click) on the corpus whose template you wish to edit and select Edit corpus template... from the context menu.
li.itemgroup: A Session Template window will appear for the selected corpus, showing the Session Information and Tier Management views.

li.p: Edit options as you see fit. Close this window when you are finished making changes.
li.itemgroup: These settings will be applied to any sessions subsequently created within the corpus.For further instructions on how to specify information in the Session Information and Tier Management views, consult , , , , and other related pages.
